meanings.definition: Not responding or reacting to something
meanings.sent1: The cat remained irresponsive to the sound of the doorbell.
meanings.sent2: She was irresponsive to the jokes, showing no sign of amusement.
meanings.sent3: The robot's irresponsive behavior to commands puzzled the engineers.
meanings.sent4: His irresponsive attitude towards criticism was like a shield against negativity.
meanings.sent5: The stone-faced guard was as irresponsive as a statue.

meanings.definition: Not showing any reaction or emotion
meanings.sent1: The irresponsive audience sat silently throughout the performance.
meanings.sent2: He remained irresponsive even when he received the surprising news.
meanings.sent3: Her irresponsive expression made it hard to tell if she liked the gift.
meanings.sent4: The old painting's colors were so faded, it looked irresponsive to light.
meanings.sent5: The irresponsive mask hid her true feelings from everyone.

meanings.sent1: The phone continued to ring, but he was irresponsive to its calls.
meanings.sent2: The student's irresponsive behavior in class worried the teacher.
meanings.sent3: The cat's irresponsive stare at the moving toy was comical.
meanings.sent4: The computer's irresponsive screen frustrated the user.
meanings.sent5: The irresponsive machine failed to recognize any input.
